tweets.text: @harrietalvis @Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency Combined sewerage systems are employed in urban areas throughout Europe. Their development brought massive public health benefits to the general population. The users of the system however repeatedly abuse the asset (FOG wipes etc) which cause havoc with CSO‚Äôs.

@Blacky_Himself @EnvAgency Also, as if they can claim that that is largely the only time discharges are occuring! Looking at the outfall data so many are discharging more than half the days of the year, there's no way you can class that many as heavy rainfall!

Due to forecasted heavy rain we have deployed Phase 1 of the #Northwich Scheme & erected temporary defences at Barons Quay. This has been done as a precautionary measure to protect the community from potential high river levels.

Check your #flood risk üëâhttps://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/F5TNr9XO7f

10:35am, Saturday

Flood alerts in west, south-west, south and south-east London and north #Surrey: flooding POSSIBLE... 

...including #Putney, #Teddington, #Wandsworth, #Croydon, #Dartford  

Full details: https://t.co/y2l94AYyu8, or from Floodline: 0345 988 1188 #floodaware https://t.co/ZfhdBygBJj
Another rainy day and more sewage floating up through our drain @wessexwater maybe at some point you‚Äôll fix it? Or do we have to cope with a 2nd winter of this??@EnvAgency https://t.co/1Lp69eoZVj

With the forecast of widespread & persistent heavy rain across the #Midlands this weekend we're getting ready for a risk of #flood, but are you?

Check your flood risk, sign up for free flood warnings & keep up to date at https://t.co/Yu9SYkYtrI or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 https://t.co/zi1MDrZbJQ

When did you last see a trout swimming in the river Chelt? - it really doesn‚Äôt look in very good condition any more, with the invasive plant Himalayan Balsam in abundance ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© https://t.co/rkOuoE2sUj

Due to expected increased river levels we are closing flood gates along the River Tees at Yarm (Phase 1), Croft and Neasham Abbey as a precaution this afternoon, and will remain closed over the weekend. #StormAlex https://t.co/pZx7unTQPx

tweets.text: Hope @EnvAgency develop backbone & protect environment. Their determination on changes to water abstraction permits needed due to pollution risk from @HS2ltd work pushed back to Jan 2021 ‚ÄúDue to a number of complex issues‚Äù 1st sign of a vertebra or an attempt to bury the problem.

It was great to meet Andy and Keith from the @EnvAgencyNW in Padiham earlier today to talk about the much needed flood defences. 
Lots of work is going on now to prepare everything, ready for main work to start next year. And completion is on track for November 2022! https://t.co/Mpy7PNZelX
